alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 5:40AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...NORTHWESTERN SEBASTIAN AND EAST CENTRAL SEQUOYAH COUNTIES... At 539 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles northwest of Van Buren, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Alma... Barling... Muldrow... Roland... Moffett... Rudy... Figure Five... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Kibler... Concord... Shibley... Dora... Furry... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 323 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
